attributes.action: Take actions to eliminate bullying to teenage boys that enjoy Performing Arts.
attributes.background:
I'm a young boy and I really like dance - so much, that I would like to do it as a career. But unfortunately this isn't an easy thing to do - lots of homophobic bullying is involved. This shouldn't be tolerated. Boys and girls are equal - and so should be treated as so.
FACE THE FACTS, BOYS DANCE!

attributes.action: Criminalise politicians and the media for lying, misleading or misinforming.
attributes.background: The EU referendum was the biggest decision in modern history. But the decision made was based on lies, misinformation and speculation. We need an independent body with the power to impose legal repercussions on politicians and media organisations for circulating misleading or untrue claims.
attributes.additional_details:
Gisela Stuart, Boris Johnson and Michael Gove said: 
"After we Vote Leave, there won’t be a sudden change that disrupts the economy." Yet the Brexit vote triggered the biggest fall in the pound in history.
Nigel Farage disowns Vote Leave '£350m for the NHS pledge' hours after EU referendum result. Also, the £350 million figure was deemed 'misleading' (UK Statistics Authority). 
The Sun published "The Queen backs Brexit" - Buckingham Palace complained to IPSO about this claim.

attributes.action: Require a new referendum on EU with minimum 5% majority to be valid.
attributes.background: With new facts that have come to light, so many people voting based in mis-information and lack of detail, and the divided country we now live in, we want a new referendum on leaving the EU with a clear 5% majority. It's too an important decision to accept a 2% lead and a divided country.

attributes.action: To implement a national standard for the design of cycle lanes by cyclists.
attributes.background: A lot of money has been spent recently on local cycle schemes that have been very poorly implimented; therefore not having the desired effect and in some places making the roads more dangerous for all road users. I believe there should be a national standard for the design of cycle routes and paths.
attributes.additional_details:
£29 million cycle route with very poor sections - http://www.yorkshireeveningpost.co.uk/news/design-of-flagship-29m-leeds-to-bradford-cycle-superhighway-will-set-cycling-back-1-7916928
Some photos of poorly placed cycle lanes -https://www.theguardian.com/environment/gallery/2009/nov/05/readers-worst-cycle-https://www.buzzfeed.com/jonstone/22-london-cycle-lanes-that-hate-cyclists?utm_term=.fee8zBePA#.qta6MxrlB

attributes.action: Ban, for at least one year, petitions on the EU referendum.
attributes.background: Rerunning debates in Parliament that have been discussed ad nauseum takes up the valuable time of MPs. The country needs to settle after a protracted build up to the recent EU referendum. Forcing further debate in Parliament is negative.

attributes.action: Give Scotland a referendum with option for independence ONLY if UK leaves EU
attributes.background: Many people in Scotland only want independence because the UK is leaving the EU and should be given this explicit option. If results of this referendum show that leaving the EU will lead to breakup of the UK, there should be another UK referendum on leaving EU as leave voters did not know this.
attributes.additional_details: Following the EU leave vote, Scottish First Minister Nicola Sturgeon is seeking an independence referendum on grounds that Scottish people do not want to leave EU. However leave voters did not know that Scottish independence was a consequence of their vote. The fairest way to address this is to urgently hold a Scottish referendum which would be binding only if UK continues to leave EU. Then UK should be given second referendum in full knowledge of the consequences of leaving EU.

attributes.action: Give free British citizenship to EU immigrants working in the UK over 5 years.
attributes.background: The U.K. is demonstrating a hostile feeling towards all immigrants.And now we are a population that feel openly ostracised,voiceless,discriminated against and unwelcome. We need clear evidence that we are wanted and welcome in this country and proof that we are an integral part of the U.K.'s future.
attributes.additional_details: The leaders of this country have a lot to answer to Immigrants for now.What's in it for us now that we are out of the EU and living in the UK? Besides xenophobia and ostracisation? What certainties are there for immigrants' future as members of this society and how are we clearly a part of the strategy for a United Kingdom that no longer abides by the laws and regulations of the EU. Giving us British citizenship will be the only true way immigrants will feel included and part of the U.K. again.
attributes.creator_name: Vasco Sérgio Rodrigues Gaspar de Almeida Santos

attributes.action: Increased court powers and sentences for racially motivated attacks.
attributes.background: In the wake of the referendum, there have been massively increased reports of racially motivated attacks on foreign born nationals and Muslims. We need much tougher sentences to stop this from becoming the norm.

attributes.action: A UK Bill of Rights should be introduced as the country leaves the EU.
attributes.background: With the outcome of the UK Referendum now known, many people are concerned about losing the protection of ECHR. A Bill of Rights to protect and enhance our freedoms is a clear statement of our country's commitment to these principles. It should be introduced to coincide with our exit from the Union.

attributes.action: Have a referendum on whether the citizens of UK want the breakup of the UK.
attributes.background: Following the EU referendum and the prospect that Northern Ireland and Scotland will leave the United Kingdom, and 48 % of people did not want the UK to leave the EU, this historic breakup of the UK should be the subject of a referendum.

attributes.action: EU referendum results CAN NOT be OVERTURNED or PETITIONED against within 4 years
attributes.background: If a referendum result has been won there should not be another referendum called to dispute the original within 4 years.

attributes.action: Restrict petition signatories to 1 UK IP addresses ONLY to prevent further abuse
attributes.background: The petitions system is being blatantly abused by people who feel it is OK to use false data and sign a petition multiple times (and even write scripts to automate it), and that most critically non-eligible voters, outside of the UK are being allowed to steer our democratic process through fraud.
attributes.additional_details: Due to the expansion of social media, viral ideas are able to spread globally in minutes.  As we have seen in several recent petitions that have exploded overnight, that people on twitter, Facebook, 4chan, etc. are actively promoting petition fraud by having people sign using false UK addresses, and fraudulently declaring themselves to be eligible UK voters.  THIS MUST BE STOPPED.  It would be easily implemented (reduced) if Geographic IP filters are introduced, and IP addresses logged.

attributes.action: If MP's veto EU referendum result a General Election must be called.
attributes.background:
Some MP's from the Remain camp of the recent EU referendum, such as David Lammy, are suggesting that MP's should not vote through the result in parliament. 
If this is the case then all MP's should know that they are accountable to the public and a General Election be called immediately.
attributes.additional_details:
When the MP's are asked to vote whether to vote through the referendum result or not, then this should be a public ballot and not a secret ballot. 
This will ensure that the nation have the perfect opportunity to vote out, if they so wish, any MP's that have decided that democracy is only preferable when it is on their own terms.

attributes.action: Extend existing points immigration rules to non-Common Travel Area nationals
attributes.background: We petition parliament to extend the points based immigration system that applies to non-EU nationals to the citizens of countries outside the Common Travel Area, and make necessary adjustments to the points requirements to ensure an adequate supply of labour to the various sectors of the economy.
attributes.additional_details:
Common travel area: https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/common-travel-area-cta/common-travel-area-cta

Immigration rules that apply to non-EU citizens: https://www.gov.uk/guidance/immigration-rules/immigration-rules-index

attributes.action: Make it law that a 2nd referendum cant be called for 20 years after the 1st.
attributes.background: To protect the democratic purpose of a refurendum a 2nd should not be held just because people disagree with the outcome. Having the law would mean people are fully aware of the consequences of voting in the first place. Its unfair for people to cast a vote then have to worry it could be overturned
attributes.additional_details: 2014 scottish independance from the UK referendum & 2016 UK membership of the EU referendum. These are two examples where calls for a 2nd referendum should be cancelled out by law, the decision has been made and should be respected.

attributes.action: Make voting eligible to only those who have paid PAYE tax for 5 or more years
attributes.background: Due to the backlash from the EU referendum from individuals who have no interest in what happens to the ordinary citizen and big businesses who are only interested in lining their pockets, we wish there to restrictions where only those who have paid into the country may vote for it's future.

attributes.action: Allow the youth (14-17) to vote in larger elections/referendums
attributes.background:
Big decisions affects them as well, and their future should be the prime concern at the heart of future referendums. 
At the end of the day it is there futures on the line and it would be selfish to deny them a vote.
not letting them vote would be scandalous and would cause outrage among them.
attributes.additional_details:
This is backed up by the fact that YouGov's statistics said 18-24 year olds mostly voted to remain. 
Young people are also told to voice their opinion and this would help them alot, whilst also introducing them to politics and wanting to contribute to society.

attributes.action: Make voting be required by law from the age of 16
attributes.background: Turnouts in elections/referendums can be low meaning there are people out there not represented by the governments we elect or by the choices made in referendums - make voting be required by law, where if you don't vote you are fined (unless exceptional circumstances) and lower the voting age to 16

attributes.action: Compulsory Voting Onile for all above the age of 14
attributes.background: We the undersigned call upon HM Government to implement a rule for all future referendum that voting is made compulsory for all above the age of 14 and is conducted online.
attributes.additional_details: Due to the criticality of the recent referendum the whole of the population was not represented particularly the young teenagers who are to live with this desicion for the rest of their lives. Online voting would be appealing to the young generation and would keep costs to a minimum in times of austerity.

attributes.action: Introduce a Code of Conduct for all political advertising.
attributes.background: Since 1999 party political advertising has been outside any code of conduct and is unregulated. The content of some written and broadcast material from both sides in the recent referendum would breach the Advertising Standards Authority's code of practice if it applied to political parties.
attributes.additional_details:
To maintain freedom of expression we propose the code of conduct be applied to all written material and to broadcasts where there is no immediate ability to challenge a statement.

We petition that all statements made in both written and broadcast material meet the following criteria:
Statements implied as fact should be truthful, evidence based and responsible and not misleading or inflame or incite fear or hatred.   Statements that are based on opinion should be clearly indicated as such.

attributes.action: A referendum on whether or not parliament should endorse the Brexit vote
attributes.background: Only 51.9% of the 72% who voted supported the Brexit. The impact of Brexit will be such that the decision should not be left to this 37.368% of the electorate. This is not enough to endorse Brexit alone. An effort has to be made to ensure that a practical plan is made that the public can review.
attributes.additional_details:
This is not calling for another EU referendum. This is calling for a referendum on the consequence of the EU referendum. 

http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-politics-36616028

attributes.action: Let 17 year olds vote in a 2nd EU Referendum
attributes.background: The 17 year olds in the UK should also get the chance to vote as it is our future that the older generations are deciding upon. There is a precedent for us to be able to vote, as 16 year olds were allowed to vote in the Scottish Referendum

attributes.action: London should be re-classified as part of Scotland in light of the EU vote.
attributes.background: In light of how the various regions voted in the EU referendum, I propose that London should be re-classified as part of Scotland. Thus enabling us to remain part of the EU if, as is likely, Scotland votes for independence from the UK.
attributes.additional_details: This would enable London's financial markets to still have the benefits of EU membership and would also strengthen the Scottish economy.

attributes.action: London to receive the same treatment as Scotland in a Vote to remain in the EU
attributes.background:
London Voted democratically to stay in with EU. Our businesses, lives and culture thrive on being a world city tolerant and thriving thanks to migration.

We voted IN! But they want to take us OUT. 

Sign this if you believe London deserves the same treatment as Scotland in its future.
attributes.additional_details: It's perfectly reasonable to propose a one country two systems format, that runs successfully in other countries, and allow London its democratic decision.

attributes.action: We want a public database so we can see who we voted for in each election.
attributes.background: We want a transparent world and I believe being able to see who we voted for as well as our peers is a big step in this. We have the technology to do this with ease. It also makes sure that the whole system isn't corrupt.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for all shops and companies using job applicants as free labour
attributes.background: Make it illegal for all shops and companies using job applicants as free labour disguising it as a trial. This is wrong it gives applicants the impression that they have a job when in fact they don't. Anyone who carries out work should be paid

attributes.action: Force retailers in airports and ports to pass on VAT/duty savings to consumers.
attributes.background: In 2015 it was exposed that many retailers in airports and ports do not pass on VAT savings to passengers travelling outside the EU and instead pocket the cash as extra profit. The government has failed to act on this issue costing consumers thousands. Retailers should pass on the full 20% saving.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/business-35197809

attributes.action: we want the government to take control over BHS until a buyer is found.
attributes.background: Lots of people will loose their jobs at no fault of there own, we the HONEST and hard working feel that the government is not doing enough for these people who have dedicated their lives to this company, and as a tax payer I feel like many others that more should be done to safeguard there future

attributes.action: Make it the law for defibrillators to be at sports centres, schools, businesses
attributes.background: Earlier this year I went to a netball tournament as usual and during the match a friends mum dropped down in front of us and died, if there was a defibrillator at the sports centre she could've lived. This isn't good enough, we should go out of our way to keep lives safe. Make defibrillators the law
attributes.additional_details: Cardiac arrests and Sudden Adult Death affects everyone, no one is safe from this dreadful thing. Therefore I want to encourage all adults and young people to sign and give support to make a change!

attributes.action: Make it law that every childcare setting has cctv cameras on at all times
attributes.background: My sons nursery has been closed down due to staff being accused of child cruelty. However there is no physical evidence. All childcare settings by law should have cctv in operation for the protection of children and transparency

attributes.action: Make the parliamentary select committee process similar to a civil court hearing
attributes.background: Having recently seen the parliamentary select committee for Dominic Chappell regarding BHS, it seemed all too easy for him to make unsubstantiated statements in defence of his conduct, and hide behind documents not being readily available.
attributes.additional_details: For example,  when Chappell was asked how much profit he made from BHS he did not have the answer and said he would provide it 'as soon as practicable ', this would not have happened if there was a proper process in place.  This absolutely crucial information should have been required by the committee in advance.

attributes.action: This government to urgently strengthen the defence of our coastline
attributes.background: It is a disgrace that the UK has only 3 naval vessels to patrol over 7000 miles of coastline whilst countries like the Netherlands has 16 vessels and Italy has 600. Recent events have highlighted acts of gunrunning and people traffickers landing on remote beaches and marinas.

attributes.action: Make all use & movement of HGV during peak times; 7-9am & 3-6pm illegal.
attributes.background:
Our lives are busy. Getting the kids ready for school, working hard all day, paying our tax.
The last thing we need is to be stuck behind a lorry or in a huge queue because of a number of HGV's at the traffic lights ahead. 
Imagine how easier the commute would be without any HGV's on the road.
attributes.additional_details:
I propose we limit the amount of time the HGV drivers are allowed to drive on the road. 
I'm a HGV driver myself but I'm also in the military and must commute to work through Leicester every morning and for a reasonably small city, the traffic is ridiculous and its usually because an HGV is sat at the lights, takes 9-10 seconds to select a gear and pull away, in which time the lights are red again. 

Limiting the HGV to an off peak travel would free up our roads and limit congestion.

attributes.action: Make it legal that there is a 2 hour minimum break per day for  live in carers.
attributes.background: Make it legally binding that all live-in care work,  though agencys ensure a 2 hour minimum break per day for carers. There should also  be a waking night carer throughout the night if necessary. carers are exploited by care agencies and private employers as there are no fixed rules for breaks
attributes.additional_details: Most live-in carers are too afraid to speak up in case they lose their job or get bad references. It is very common for carers to work up to 16 hours a day, plus getting up during the night. Most carers get paid from £65 to £95 per day and are still expected to have a happy disposition and fulfill all their duties - often without breaks. Slavery was abolished in the UK nearly 200 years ago. Please stop live in care givers being exploited  give them the voice and rights they deserve.

attributes.action: Publish the postal vote count separately at elections and referendums.
attributes.background: Given widespread concerns about the potential for electoral fraud being easier to perpetrate through postal voting than 'in-person' voting, we propose that postal votes be counted separately from the 'in-person' vote and the numbers for each count be published when the results are declared.
attributes.additional_details:
Electoral fraud is much easier to perpetrate through postal voting than voting in person as the opportunities for personation offences are multiplied significantly compared to where a person needs to present themselves at a polling station.

If there is significant variance between the two counts, any irregularities can be more easily highlighted and if necessary, investigated.

attributes.action: Stop Privatisation Public Transport and British Business
attributes.background: All Business and Transport should be handed back to the Government including Great Western Railways as Trains including buses will be cheaper for the public to buy tickets. Also British Gas and other Business which were owned by the government to be re instated also to reduce Air Passenger Tax....
attributes.additional_details: On Long haul Flights.

attributes.action: Amalgamate all examination boards in the UK into one Government regulated board
attributes.background:
-Inaccurate marking (many re-marks go up)
-Schools play game of "picking easiest board" to improve results
-Over-burdened markers leads to poor quality
-Ambiguity of papers/questions
-Difficulty/Simplicity of papers
attributes.additional_details:
The National Association for the Teaching of English (NATE) has identified significant issues with quality of A-level marking, including, "a crisis in confidence" with exam boards.

A new book by University of Cambridge professors has sharply criticized England’s exam boards system as being “bizarre” and “untenable”.

Mick Waters, former Director of Curriculum at the Qualifications and Curriculum Agency, who says that exam boards are “diseased” and “almost corrupt”.

attributes.action: Ban the use of non-rewirable (moulded) plugs on electrical appliances.
attributes.background:
Non-rewirable plugs cannot be re-used once the appliance they are attached to is discarded. This adds to land-fill as otherwise reusable plugs are discarded with non-working appliances (fridges, kettles etc.).
Additionally, non-rewirable plugs are more hazardous to children than rewirable plugs.
attributes.additional_details:
Because non-rewirable plugs are very difficult to remove from the cables to which they are attached, they are more likely to be left on discarded cable, posing a risk to children (See: http://www.fatallyflawed.org.uk/html/other_dangers.html).

Over six million electrical items are thrown away every year in the UK (http://www.recycle-more.co.uk/pwpcontrol.php?pwpID=12809). If half of these items had non-rewirable plugs, that's three million usable plugs being discarded yearly in the UK.

attributes.action: Overhaul the democratic system to get leaders to care about the future
attributes.background: The problem: Democracy in it's current format does not create an atmosphere where politicians need to care about the future and most voters are easily manipulated and selfish so also do not care about the future.
attributes.additional_details:
The solution:
Elect a sole leader by means of "Range voting".

This leader will stay in control of the country until 
A) They retire
B) They get under 25% votes in an 'in/out' vote held annually. 
Then we elect a new one. 

Then they will be answerable to the people still but will have the ability to create long term plans and visions for making our country great again. 

Note: Range voting is scoring the candidates 1, 2, ... In the order you prefer them. You don't have to give all a number.

attributes.action: Reduce Fees on Degrees that lead to Jobs in Public Services (Government Jobs)
attributes.background: Healthcare? Funded. Scientists? We cover them. Why is more not being done with the training for these roles? If a student agrees to terms where they're guaranteed a GVT job after completing their course, then fees for this student should either be scrapped entirely, or considerably discounted.
attributes.additional_details: How it would work: On beginning a degree such as medicine, physics, or one in teaching, you alert the government that upon the course's conclusion, you are happy to accept a predetermined government/public-services role (e.g. surgeon/MI5 agent/psychiatrist/physicist) with employment-terms as defined by the GVT. If you leave the course or job-role before a certain amount of time, then the fees will be charged like any other degree (as you won't have used it for the GVT's intended purpose).

attributes.action: Require a referendum before any decision on the privatisation of public services
attributes.background: In recent times the Post Office has been sold to private ownership and it would seem that the NHS is being sold in small increments currently. All of this happens without the confirmation of the UK voting population. A referendum would, at the least, raise a large amount of awareness to the public.

attributes.action: Please Reform The Year 6 SATs
attributes.background:
Last night my son was violently sick, this wasn't from illness, but from the stress of the SATs.
I've seen a massive change in his usual behaviour regardless of my comfort and reassurance. I would like the testing to be spread out over the last term, not crammed into one week.
attributes.additional_details:
The SATs Timetable
Monday 9 May 2016-Key stage 2 English reading test, reading booklet and associated answer booklet.
Tuesday 10 2016- Key stage 2 English grammar, punctuation and spelling test, Paper 1, short answer questions. Key stage 2 English grammar, punctuation and spelling test, Paper 2, spelling.
Wednesday 11 May 2016-Key stage 2 mathematics, Paper 1 arithmetic test. Key stage 2 mathematics, Paper 2 reasoning.
Thursday 12 May 2016	Key stage 2 mathematics, Paper 3, reasoning

attributes.action: Make it illegal for companies not to plant as many trees as they destroy.
attributes.background: Trees are disappearing at an unsustainable rate. It is time to act. Many companies plant more trees than they use already, but to make any real change it must be made illegal for them not to do so.

attributes.action: Overseas Aid should be a voluntary opt in contribution collected via HMRC.
attributes.background: It is funded via my taxes and much of it is being fraudulently used by corrupt regimes such as those Mr Cameron named. The people of this country have the right to expect its elected representatives to spend taxes on their needs particularly on  defence of the realm.

attributes.action: Make horse ownership illegal
attributes.background: Horse ownership is slavery: a cruel, unnecessary practice that puts each and every horse through unimaginable horrors and humiliation. Horses were born to roam free on wild, open fields, but they have been captured and broken in for generations, with no reprieve. Help us end this monstrous cruelty!
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.peta.org/about-peta/faq/how-does-peta-feel-about-horseback-riding/

http://www.peta.org/issues/animals-in-entertainment/animals-used-entertainment-factsheets/charreada-bone-breaking-cruelty/

attributes.action: Make it illegal for job advertisements to omit salary and benefits.
attributes.background:
The gender pay gap is a big, and unnecessary, issue  

In the interest of consistency, equality and fairness making it mandatory to enumerate salary and benefits on any job advertisement   would make it clear internally and externally that a company is committed to transparency.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.theguardian.com/money/2016/mar/07/gender-pay-gap-uk-women-earn-300000-less-men-lifetime

http://www.ons.gov.uk/employmentandlabourmarket/peopleinwork/earningsandworkinghours/bulletins/annualsurveyofhoursandearnings/2015provisionalresults#main-points

Even if this 

http://uk.businessinsider.com/statistics-on-the-gender-pay-gap-for-men-and-women-2016-3

is substantially correct publishing salaries on adverts is hardly going to hinder gender equality.

attributes.action: Spend more money on public services rather than spending it on the military.
attributes.background: 2% of our GDP is spent on our military, a statistic from 2014, that figure has gone done by 0.3% over the last 4 years but our GDP has been rising, meaning more is spent on the military, but public services like the NHS and the police force spending is decreasing.We want more money spent on services
attributes.additional_details: whilst our military spending rises due to our warmongering and being a puppet state to america our public services are getting no extra funding. for the last couple of years the government said that they will fix the NHS and increase the police force but they have done they have done is decrease the spending. The north welsh armed police have to help Cheshire to cut costs because they don't get enough funding. Only 3000 police were at hand to stop the riot in London 2011,an entire city to cover.

attributes.action: Make may 2nd a national holiday to mark Leicester city's title win
attributes.background: On the 2014/15 season Leicester just missed relegation, on the 2015/16 won the premier league with odds of 5000/1. As one of the greatest sporting shocks of modern football, may 2nd should be made a holiday

attributes.action: Prevent tractors from using main roads during rush hour.
attributes.background: Rush hour is already a stressful part of the day, with the inclusion of tractors, causing long tail backs (and not pulling over), not being able to overtake because of the time of day this is making commutes longer and workers late.

attributes.action: Confirm that there are no current or future plans to privatise the NHS
attributes.background: With the increasing persistent demand that Junior Doctors adopt a new contract that is not viable and will endanger patients health and the slow privatisation of some parts of the NHS. The government need to publically and on formal record confirm they have no intention to fully privatise the NHS.
attributes.additional_details: Some aspects of the ambulance service have been privatised as have some 'back office' functions. This latest contract being imposed on doctors is another way of taking control and imposing change on an already struggling NHS service. In order to show the governments committed to supporting and ensuring the continuation of the NHS they need to confirm what to date they have failed to do. That the NHS is a vital public service that WILL NOT ever be privatised but will instead be protected against it.
